name: gad7_en
title: Generalized Anxiety Disorder 7-item Scale (GAD-7)
description: The GAD-7 is a 7-item self-report measure designed to screen for Generalized Anxiety Disorder (GAD) and measure its severity over the past two weeks.
disclaimer: This questionnaire is for informational and self-monitoring purposes only and does not constitute a diagnosis of an anxiety disorder. Only a qualified mental health professional can provide a diagnosis.
source: Developed by Drs. Robert L. Spitzer, Janet B.W. Williams, Kurt Kroenke and colleagues. Available at phqscreeners.com

questions.title: Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge?
Not being able to stop or control worrying?
Worrying too much about different things?
Being so restless that it's hard to sit still?
Feeling afraid as if something awful might happen?

interpretation.label: Minimal or no symptoms of anxiety reported
interpretation.recommendation: Your responses suggest a low level of reported anxiety symptoms. Continue monitoring your well-being.

interpretation.label: Mild symptoms of anxiety reported
interpretation.recommendation: Your responses suggest a mild level of reported anxiety symptoms. Consider engaging in self-care activities and continued self-monitoring.

interpretation.label: Moderate symptoms of anxiety reported
interpretation.recommendation: Your responses suggest a moderate level of reported anxiety symptoms. You may find benefit in exploring professional support.

interpretation.label: Severe symptoms of anxiety reported
interpretation.recommendation: Your responses suggest a severe level of reported anxiety symptoms. It is strongly recommended that you consider consulting a mental health professional.
